intro: Vieillardia gigantocarpa, commonly known as the giant giant-lobed tree, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in diameter, making it one of the largest leafy plants in the world. Its flowers are showy, with bright yellow petals and a distinctive, elongated calyx. The tree produces woody pods containing seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
